Posted By: bowlofgumbo (11/13/2011 6:24:50 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I started playing magic in early 1995. By that time, I've heard of Black Lotus every now & then from my friends.  
I wanted to buy one but, of course, it's too late to get one already. To think that it came out just more than a year and a half before i started buying & playing MTG.   
  
I don't think I'll live to see this card getting reprinted. Even a [Lotus Petal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Petal) is hard to find nowadays. Well, at least i got four petals in my collection. Damn, where did i put that time machine of mine. :)
posts.html:
I started playing magic in early 1995. By that time, I've heard of Black Lotus every now & then from my friends.
I wanted to buy one but, of course, it's too late to get one already. To think that it came out just more than a year and a half before i started buying & playing MTG.

I don't think I'll live to see this card getting reprinted. Even a Lotus Petal is hard to find nowadays. Well, at least i got four petals in my collection. Damn, where did i put that time machine of mine. :)

Posted By: dragonking987 (3/7/2011 1:40:14 PM)

posts.post_content:
Really, why do people care about this dying to [Shatter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shatter)? It even dies to [Crush](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crush)! :D :D :D  
  
By the way, for anyone still not understanding: If you play it on your first turn, your opponent won't have mana for playing an artifact removal. And, more important, you usually play and then immediately sacrifice this one, so your opponent can't cast anything between resolving and sacrificing...
posts.html:
Really, why do people care about this dying to Shatter? It even dies to Crush! :D :D :D

posts.post_content:
Turn 1:  
Forest, Black lotus: Sacrifice to play [Garruk Wildspeaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk Wildspeaker): -1; 3/3 Beast  
Turn 2:  
Forest, tap both, then untap using Garruk, and tap again for the [wilt-leaf liege](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=wilt-leaf liege), attack with 4/4 beast, probably blocked, but through: 16 life  
Turn 3:  
Forest, tap all, untap two: +1, cast [Ant Queen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ant Queen) (or whatsoever), attack with 4/4 and 4/4: 8 life  
Turn 4:  
Garruk's -4, attack with 25: -17 life  
  
I know that this can be more efficient, garruk ***during turn one*** is just fun
